entry.tran: 动人的;感人的;令人同情的
entry.def: If something is touching, it causes feelings of sadness or sympathy.

example.ex: Her story is the touching tale of a wife who stood by the husband she loved...
example.tran: 她的经历是一个妻子坚定地支持她深爱着的丈夫的感人故事。

example.ex: It was a very, very touching moment.
example.tran: 那是个非常非常感人的瞬间。

means.word_mean: 1. the event of something coming in contact with the body;

sentences.sentence: "he longed for the touch of her hand"
"the cooling touch of the night air"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of putting two things together with no space between them;

sentences.sentence: "at his touch the room filled with lights"
"the homecoming of the released hostages was an affecting scene"

auth_sentence.content: Before then his gratitude to his defenders was touching.

auth_sentence.content: I am writing these words without touching a key.

means.word_mean: 令人同情的,感人的,动人的

sentences.en: There was a touching air of innocence about the boy.
sentences.cn: 这个男孩有一种令人感动的天真神情。

sentences.en: She showed a touching faith in my ability to resolve any and every difficulty.
sentences.cn: 她相信我有能力解决任何困难，这令人感动。
